translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Triad of Conditions
The internal condition triad, the wholesome triad

original: Ajjhattikaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naajjhattiko nakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: ajjhattikam kusalam dhammam paṭicca na ajjhattikaḥ na kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an internal wholesome condition as its support, a non-internal non-wholesome condition arises, by way of condition being a root-cause.

original: Bāhiraṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naajjhattiko nakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Ajjhattikaṁ kusalañca bāhiraṁ kusalañca dhammaṁ paṭicca naajjhattiko nakusalo dhammo🔽uppajjati hetupaccayā. Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: bāhiram kusalam dhammam paṭicca na ajjhattikaḥ na kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  ajjhattikam kusalañca bāhiram kusalañca dhammam paṭicca na ajjhattikaḥ na kusalaḥ dhammaḥ  uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With an external wholesome condition as its support, a non-internal non-wholesome condition arises, by way of condition being a root-cause.🔽With an internal wholesome and an external wholesome condition as its support, a non-internal non-wholesome condition arises, by way of condition being a root-cause. There are three (other) conditions. … In the case of the unspecific, there are three (other) conditions.

original: Ajjhattikaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naajjhattiko naakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Bāhiraṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naajjhattiko naakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: ajjhattikam akusalam dhammam paṭicca na ajjhattikaḥ na akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  bāhiram akusalam dhammam paṭicca na ajjhattikaḥ na akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an internal unwholesome condition as its support, a non-internal unwholesome condition arises, by way of condition being a root-cause.🔽With an external unwholesome condition as its support, a non-internal unwholesome condition arises, by way of condition being a root-cause.

original: Ajjhattikaṁ akusalañca bāhiraṁ akusalañca dhammaṁ paṭicca naajjhattiko naakusalo
analyzed: ajjhattikam akusalañca bāhiram akusalañca dhammam paṭicca na ajjhattikaḥ na akusalaḥ
translated: With an internal unwholesome and an external unwholesome condition as its support, a non-internal unwholesome condition arises, by way of condition being a root-cause.

original: dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Abyākatamūlaṁ tīṇiyeva paccayavasena.)
analyzed: dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi abyākata mūlam tīṇi eva paccaya vasena
translated: a factor arises with a condition being a condition. With a cause as condition, there are three … with outflows as condition, there are three. (The root of the unwholesome and the root of the unwholesome and the root of the indeterminate are the same as the root of the wholesome.)
